Name: Thai Green Curry
Description: A fragrant and spicy curry dish with a rich green curry paste, tender chicken, and vegetables in a creamy coconut milk sauce.
Ingredients: 1 cup of mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, zucchini, and green beans)
Fresh basil leaves and lime wedges for garnish
Directions: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
Add the minced garlic and sliced onion to the skillet and saut√© for 2-3 minutes, until the onion is translucent.
Add the green curry paste to the skillet and cook for 1 minute, stirring to coat the onion and garlic with the paste.
Add the sliced chicken breast to the skillet and cook for 4-5 minutes, until the chicken is browned on all sides.
Pour in the coconut milk and chicken broth, and stir to combine.
Add the mixed vegetables to the skillet and bring the mixture to a simmer.
Cover the skillet and let the curry simmer for 10-12 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
Stir in the fish sauce and brown sugar, and season with salt to taste.
Serve the Thai green curry hot, garnished with fresh basil leaves and lime wedges.
Pair it with steamed rice or noodles for a complete meal.
Enjoy the aromatic and flavorful Thai green curry!
